data.title: Primavera
data.description: One of the famous paintings, Primavera is the largest panel painting in tempera paint by Botticelli.

data.title: The Large Bathers
data.description: This is the largest, the last work from Cézanne’s lifelong exploration, and perhaps in its unfinished state, it is pure and serene.

data.title: Hope II
data.description: The painting depicts a female with a cranium sheltered into her dressing gown, who turns her head down towards her rounded belly.

data.title: Nude Descending a Staircase
data.description: This artwork by Marcel Duchamp and Rrose Sélavyis is a Modernist classic and has become one of the most famous paintings of its time.

data.title: Liberty Leading the People
data.description: It is about Commemorating the July Revolution of 1830, which toppled King Charles X of France’.

data.title: rises
data.description: History says that it was one of Van Gogh’s last paintings before he shot himself with a revolver.

data.title: The Swing
data.description: Known as the Happy Accidents of the Swing, is an 18th-century oil painting by Jean-Honoré Fragonard.

data.title: Bal du moulin de la Galette
data.description: The scene portrays a regular Sunday afternoon at the Moulin de la Galette located in the district of Montmartre in Paris.

data.title: Nighthawks
data.description: The painting has meticulously depicted the isolation of people, felt in a modern urban setting.

data.title: The Storm On The Sea Of Galilee
data.description: The biblical scene represents nature against human vulnerability; however, it also shows faith in seemingly calm and unbothered Jesus.

data.title: Christina’s World
data.description: Christina features a young woman seen from behind, wearing a pastel dress and lying in the grassy field.

data.title: The Sleeping Gypsy
data.description: The dream-like atmosphere and simple geometric designs bring attention to Rousseau’s remarkable illustrative imagination.

data.title: Le Déjeuner Sur l’herbe
data.description: The 16th-century work of art The Pastoral Concert and The Judgment of Paris was Manet’s inspiration for this artwork.

data.title: The Great Wave off Kanagawa
data.description: While sometimes assumed to be a tsunami, the wave is likely to be a large rogue wave, featuring the shadow of Mt. Fiji in the background.

data.title: Lady With An Ermine
data.description: Painted on a wooden panel in oils, this widely attributed and famous artwork portrays a half-length figure of a woman by Leonardo Da Vinci.

data.title: Olympia
data.description: Manet’s famous painting of Olympia, was not showcased until two years later after its completion.

data.title: Van Gogh Self-Portrait (Without Beard)
data.description: Vincent van Gogh’s Self-Portrait without Beard is certainly one of the most notable paintings of all time.

data.title: The Third of May
data.description: The painting speaks about liberation, particularly in the context of Spain’s turbulent history.

data.title: No.5, 1948
data.description: In this painting, Pollock was using new techniques to express his emotions with colors and lines.

data.title: The School of Athens
data.description: The Picture is Raphael’s masterpiece and an absolute personification of the classical spirit of the Renaissance.

data.title: Café Terrace At Night
data.description: Of all the classic paintings, The Cafe Terrace on the Place du Forum is one of its kind.

data.title: The Son of Man
data.description: A hovering green apple covers the man’s face; however, the man’s eyes peek over the edge of the apple.

data.title: Sistine Chapel Ceiling
data.description: The Sistine Chapel is known as the greatest example of High Renaissance art.

data.title: Starry Night Over The Rhône
data.description: ‘Starry nights over the Rhone’, captures the reflections of the gaslighting in Arles across the glimmering blue water of the Rhone.

data.title: Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I
data.description: In the 1940s, the Nazis seized the painting and renamed it The Woman in Gold, to remove any references to the Jewish family name.

data.title: Salvator Mundi
data.description: “As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.”- Leonardo Da Vinci

data.title: Luncheon Of The Boating Party
data.description: Known as one of the most versatile Impressionist painters the ‘luncheon of the boating Party’ is Auguste Renoir’s most renowned work.

data.title: Wanderer Above The Sea Of Fog
data.description: Believed to be a self-portrait, the young figure standing above the valley cloaked in mountain mist has the same fiery red hair as the artist.

data.title: Whistler’s Mother
data.description: Also known as Arrangement in Grey and Black No. 1, made on oil on canvas created by the painter James McNeill Whistler.

data.title: The Flower Carrier
data.description: Known in its native tongue as “Cargador de Flores” is painted on a Masonite.

data.title: American Gothic
data.description: Painted with oil on Beaver Board, this is Grant Wood’s most impressive painting.

data.title: Impression, Sunrise
data.description: Impression, Sunrise was painted at Monet’s hometown, on the port of Le Havre in France, said to be completed in one sitting.

data.title: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
data.description: He was an ambitious young man with a scientific theory to prove, Seurat was the pioneer in the technique of pointillist.

data.title: Les Demoiselles d’Avignon
data.description: ‘Les Demoiselles d’Avignon’ is seen as a proto-cubism and is considered as the most influential painting in the cubism art form.

data.title: Arnolfini Portrait
data.description: It depicts the Italian businessperson Giovanni di Nicolao Arnolfini and his wife, presumptively in their house in the Flemish town of Bruges.

data.title: The Garden of Earthly Delights
data.description: Hieronymus Bosch’s triptych was of creation, human futility and damnation was the depiction of the fleetingness of human life.

data.title: The Night Watch
data.description: Known as one of the most famous paintings of all time, Rembrandt was the master of light manipulation.

data.title: The Persistence of Memory
data.description: The Persistence of Memory is one of the most recognizable works of this Spanish artist and Surrealist icon.

data.title: Water Lilies’ Series
data.description: Over the last three decades of his life, Claude Monet Painted more than 250 water lilies paintings.

data.title: Creation of Adam
data.description: The painting takes a biblical narrative from the Book of Genesis, in which God gives life to Adam, the first man.

data.title: Las Meninas
data.description: This painting is depicting life in the court of King Philip IV of Spain and stands the 9th in the list of top famous paintings.

data.title: The Birth of Venus
data.description: Bringing a renewed interest in classic Greek culture with Early Renaissance style.

data.title: The Girl With The Pearl Earring
data.description: Girl With a Pearl Earring is Johannes Vermeer’s most celebrated and mysterious artwork.

data.title: The Kiss
data.description: The painting portrays a passionate couple holding each other and their bodies tangled in complex decorative robes.

data.title: Guernica
data.description: Guernica is not only a famous painting but also a powerful political statement.

data.title: The Scream
data.description: The Scream is originally titled ‘The Scream of Nature’ and it is not a single work of art.

data.title: The Starry Night
data.description: Widely hailed as his magnum opus, this painting’s beauty is timeless and universal.

data.title: The Last Supper
data.description: The painting depicts the last time Jesus broke bread with his disciples before his crucifixion.

data.title: Mona Lisa
data.description: This classic painting is not only the most famous painting but also the most expensive painting of all time.
